ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Understanding of what "American political economy" is, increased understanding of American political institutions, trends, and history.

The course really improved my understanding of social science literature in this area, and it was also a great space to think through and refine political beliefs. It was also great to learn about American Political Economy as an emerging field.
I really enjoyed the class! It was one of my favorite classes at Yale

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really like the readings for this class; they're super interesting, and well organized. My one issue is that class discussion could sometimes feel extremely intellectual and full of jargon, but that may be as much about my personal academic style preferences.
Strengths: taking broad themes of wider political interest and then providing the readings and space needed to discuss them in a rigorous way; the assignments structure.
I learned a lot about the interaction of businesses and politics and the readings are very interesting but sometimes too much.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to someone interested in American politics and who has taken prior classes that involved political science readings. For someone who doesn't have that interest and experience, the course could be a little too niche and advanced.
Absolutely! The readings are great, I left seminars having learnt a lot, the feedback on your writing is good. It's a great space to explore a wide range of themes relating to APE.
Yes! Prof Hacker is great. The topics are interesting. If you're a political science major interested in political economy, don't see why not.
Yes! I think it is very helpful and important for anyone going into business or politics.
